page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO LEADENHAM
page.content: Leadenham Village, situated on a shelf on the Lincolnshire Cliff, is surrounded by farmland. The population is 451. Being at the junction of the A17 and A607 there is easy access to the towns of Lincoln,Grantham,Sleaford and Newark.The oldest part centres round the 13th C.Church and Leadenham House, is mainly stone built.The Reeve family have lived in Leadenham House since 1738 and still own much of the surrounding land.This is one of the few remaining estate villages in the County. There are two shops,one a Post Office and Grocer;the other a Newsagent.There is a hotel with accommodation and restaurant, and also a Public House.The Village Hall is used by all the Village Clubs and Societies.The School takes pupils between 5 and 11 years.New houses have been built to the north of the Village
